adjective.description: Having a skull in which the palatoquadrate element of the upper jaw is attached to or fused with the cranium; designating a jaw or skull with suspension of this kind, found in dipnoan and chimaeroid fishes and in tetrapods.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Thomas Huxley (1825–1895), biologist and science educationist. From auto- + ancient Greek στῦλος pillar + -ic.
